content: True dat. Our definition of what love is comes from the belief that everyone but ourselves are supposed to give us our emotional needs sustainably. And while it makes sense as to why we believe that (we weren’t able to take care of ourselves when we were babies and children, so we automatically place that responsibility on our parents), it’s false. It’s not the reality. If everyone but ourselves are supposed to give us our emotional needs sustainably, everyone would be doing that, no exceptions. The fact that that’s not true means it’s false. We work best when we feel loved and lovable. Both are best done by loving ourselves first and foremost. Once we’ve given ourselves unconditional love sustainably, only then can we give others unconditional love sustainably. But learning how to love ourselves unconditionally comes outta what’s true, not what’s right.
